qas.question: Which two figures clashed over leadership of the Congo in 1997?
What is the name of Sassou's personal army?
What nationality were the forces that invaded the Congo to assist Sassou in taking control of the country?
In what month did Sassou regain the presidency?
When did Congo's democratic progress get back on track?
When did the tensions between the Lissouba and Sassou camps start to dissipate?
When did government forces surround Lissouba's compound?
What were members of Lissouba's militia called?

context: Congo's democratic progress was derailed in <b4_0>1997<b4_0/> when <a0_0>Lissouba and Sassou<a0_0/> started to fight for power in the civil war. As presidential elections scheduled for <b5_0>July 1997<b5_0/> approached, tensions between the Lissouba and Sassou camps mounted. On <b6_0>June 5<b6_0/>, President Lissouba's government forces surrounded Sassou's compound in <b7_0>Brazzaville<b7_0/> and Sassou ordered members of his private militia (known as "<a1_0><b8_0>Cobras<b8_0/><a1_0/>") to resist. Thus began a four-month conflict that destroyed or damaged much of Brazzaville and caused tens of thousands of civilian deaths. In early <a3_0>October<a3_0/>, the <a2_0>Angolan<a2_0/> socialist régime began an invasion of Congo to install Sassou in power. In mid-October, the Lissouba government fell. Soon thereafter, Sassou declared himself president.
